column4: Hi...I need some help here. I'm trying to connect my 10.10 to my XP powered Desktop. I can see the Windows Network under Places->Network->Windows Network. Whenever I try to connect it, it just returns me with the login screen again and again. Need guidance please. Thanks!
enable the guest account on xp and remove the password
Thanks! Let me try that now.
aLKy: By removing password, you mean Admin's password?
did you try using your username and password that you use to login your pc?
aLKy: Yes, I'm trying my authentication details I use to login to my XP
aLKy: Network ID also set to "MSHOME" as I read somewhere in forums.
have you tried to see if you can access the desktop from another windows machine?
aLKy: I don't have any other machine. But, I can ping my XP from here.
is it xp home or pro?
and you are trying to access shared folder?

i dont know then - could be many things - is file sharing enabled? is "server" service enabled? is there any firewalls? is your user member of a group which has permission to access from the network? there was more things but i cant remember - its been years since i've done that
